item.title: Agent-to-Sim: Learning Interactive Behavior Models from Casual Longitudinal Videos
item.description: Agent-to-Sim (ATS) learns realistic 3D agent behavior models from casual, longitudinal videos by reconstructing a persistent 4D representation and training a generative model, enabling real-to-sim tra…

item.title: Alchemy: Amplifying Theorem-Proving Capability through Symbolic Mutation
item.description: Alchemy: Amplifying Theorem-Proving with Symbolic Mutation synthesizes formal mathematical theorems, boosting neural theorem-proving performance by up to 5%.

item.title: AutoTrain: No-code training for state-of-the-art models
item.description: AutoTrain: a no-code, open-source library simplifies training state-of-the-art models on custom datasets for various tasks, democratizing access to advanced AI.

item.title: CompassJudger-1: All-in-one Judge Model Helps Model Evaluation and Evolution
item.description: CompassJudger-1: An open-source, all-in-one judge LLM offering unitary scoring, model comparison, critique generation, and diverse task execution, significantly advancing LLM evaluation.

item.title: FrugalNeRF: Fast Convergence for Few-shot Novel View Synthesis without Learned Priors
item.description: FrugalNeRF: achieving high-fidelity 3D scene reconstruction from minimal data with unprecedented speed, eliminating the need for pre-trained models.

item.title: Pangea: A Fully Open Multilingual Multimodal LLM for 39 Languages
item.description: PANGEA: A fully open multilingual, multimodal LLM trained on a diverse 6M instruction dataset, significantly outperforming existing models in multilingual and culturally diverse scenarios.

item.title: Pre-training Distillation for Large Language Models: A Design Space Exploration
item.description: Boosting large language model pre-training: This research explores pre-training distillation, systematically optimizing its design to significantly improve student LLM performance.

item.title: RM-Bench: Benchmarking Reward Models of Language Models with Subtlety and Style
item.description: RM-BENCH, a novel benchmark, rigorously evaluates reward models’ sensitivity to subtle content and style biases, showing a strong correlation with policy model performance and revealing significant ro…

item.title: SAM2Long: Enhancing SAM 2 for Long Video Segmentation with a Training-Free Memory Tree
item.description: SAM2Long enhances video object segmentation by adding a training-free memory tree, significantly improving accuracy and robustness in complex, long-term videos without needing further training.

item.title: Selecting Influential Samples for Long Context Alignment via Homologous Models' Guidance and Contextual Awareness Measurement
item.description: GATEAU, a novel framework, efficiently selects high-quality long-context samples for LLM training by using Homologous Models’ Guidance and Contextual Awareness Measurement, significantly boosting perf…

item.title: Hallucination Detox: Sensitive Neuron Dropout (SeND) for Large Language Model Training
item.description: New training method, Sensitive Neuron Dropout (SeND), reduces large language model hallucinations by up to 40% while improving efficiency.

item.title: Ichigo: Mixed-Modal Early-Fusion Realtime Voice Assistant
item.description: Ichigo, a new real-time voice assistant, leverages a novel mixed-modal early-fusion approach for superior speed and accuracy in speech-based tasks.

item.title: Baichuan Alignment Technical Report
item.description: Baichuan Alignment unveils cutting-edge techniques for aligning large language models, resulting in significant performance improvements and valuable insights for advancing AI research.

item.title: DM-Codec: Distilling Multimodal Representations for Speech Tokenization
item.description: DM-Codec, a novel speech tokenizer, leverages combined language and speech model distillation to achieve state-of-the-art performance in speech tokenization, reducing error rates significantly.

item.title: How Many Van Goghs Does It Take to Van Gogh? Finding the Imitation Threshold
item.description: Researchers discover the ‘imitation threshold’ in text-to-image models: around 200-600 training examples of a concept are needed before reliable imitation occurs.

item.title: CBT-Bench: Evaluating Large Language Models on Assisting Cognitive Behavior Therapy
item.description: CBT-BENCH: a new benchmark reveals LLMs’ potential and limitations in assisting Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, highlighting the need for further research in AI-driven mental healthcare.

item.title: Cross-Lingual Auto Evaluation for Assessing Multilingual LLMs
item.description: New framework, CIA Suite, enables accurate, automated cross-lingual evaluation of multilingual LLMs using a novel test set and evaluator LLMs, bridging the gap in multilingual NLP assessment.

item.title: In-context learning and Occam's razor
item.description: In-context learning’s success is explained by its implicit minimization of both training error and model complexity, akin to Occam’s Razor, achieved through a data compression lens.

item.title: PUMA: Empowering Unified MLLM with Multi-granular Visual Generation
item.description: PUMA: a unified multi-granular MLLM excels at diverse visual tasks by seamlessly integrating image generation and understanding, addressing varying granularity demands.

item.title: Router-Tuning: A Simple and Effective Approach for Enabling Dynamic-Depth in Transformers
item.description: Router-Tuning and MindSkip boost Transformer efficiency by dynamically adjusting computation depth, achieving 21% speedup with minimal performance loss.

item.title: SemiEvol: Semi-supervised Fine-tuning for LLM Adaptation
item.description: SEMIEVOL, a novel semi-supervised framework, significantly improves large language model adaptation by effectively leveraging both limited labeled and abundant unlabeled data, achieving superior perfo…

item.title: Meta-Chunking: Learning Efficient Text Segmentation via Logical Perception
item.description: Meta-Chunking boosts RAG performance by intelligently segmenting text into logically coherent chunks, improving knowledge retrieval and question answering.
